questList.ask: Which of the following is True for Impaled Objects...
options: Do not remove unless the airway is compromised.
Taser® darts will be removed by EMS personnel only if EMS was already dispatched to the scene for a medical/trauma event.

feedback.info:
All listed: Do not remove unless the airway is compromised.
Secure the object in place.
Taser® darts will be removed by EMS personnel only if EMS was already dispatched to the scene for a medical/trauma event.
feedback.location: See pg 34, Note items 1-12 on Taser® barbed darts

questList.ask:
Under Medical Bleeding:
Utilize M.A.R.C.H. to immediately identify and treat life-threatening conditions.
Which of the following is the correct definition of M.A.R.C.H ?
options: Massive Bleeding, Airway, Respirations, Circulation, Hypothermia
Major Bleeding, Airway, Rate of Circulation, Cyanosis, Hypothermia
Minor Bleeding, Attentive, Rate of Circulation, Cyanosis, Hypothermia

feedback.info: Massive Bleeding, Airway, Respirations, Circulation, Hypothermia

questList.ask:
Overdose:
All overdoses that are unstable/ALOC/AMS shall be dispatched as ALS. 2.
Limit scene time for no-cardiac arrest patients, with goal of ≤ 15 minutes.
Which of the following are NOT in the Decision-Making Capacity Checklist...
options: Patient is neither physically, nor cognitively impaired by alcohol and/or drug(s)
Absent of attempted suicide, verbalized suicidal intent, or other factors suggesting suicidal intent

feedback.info:
ALL are included in the Decision-Making Capacity Checklist: GCS 15
Patient is oriented
Patient is neither physically, nor cognitively impaired by alcohol and/or drug(s)
Absent of dementia
Absent of attempted suicide, verbalized suicidal intent, or other factors suggesting suicidal intent
